page.title: 04Alyth Perthshire
page.content: others. The second event was the publishing of a painting of Alyth by J.Campbell Kerr as the fronticepiece of the popular weekly "The People's Friend ". Alyth Parish Church is a prominent land mark and is still the home of a very active congregation. The present Church was built in 1839. At the top of Toutie Street where it joins High Street and Hill Street stands the old Merket Cross in the Grounds of the Former High Manse . Behind the houses on the south side of High Street at the Cross are the old arches which are part of the ruins of the old Alyth Parish Church
